column1: 11 13tadā cāgatavān sākṣān nara nārāyaṇaḥ prabhuḥ catur bhujo viśālākṣo muni veṣo ghana dyutiḥ taòit koṭi jaṭājutaḥ prasphurad dīpta maṇòalaḥ munīndra maṇòalair divyair maṇòito 'khaṇòita vrataḥ sarveṣāṃ paśyatāṃ teṣām āścarya manasā nṛpaso 'pi līno babhūvāśu śrī kṛṣṇe śyāma sundare

column1: paripūrṇatamaṃ sākṣāc chrī kṛṣṇaṃ ca svayaṃ prabhumjñātvā devaḥ stutiṃ cakruḥ paraṃ vismayam āgataḥ

column2: The demigods said: Obeisances to Śrī Kṛṣṇa, who is the Supreme Personality of Godhead, greater than the greatest, the master of sacrifices, the cause of causes, the lover of Rādhā, the most perfect, and the Lord who resides in Goloka.

column1: yogeśvaraḥ kila vadanti mahaḥ paraṃ tvāṃ tatraiva sātvatatamāḥ kṛta vigrahaṃ caasmābhir adya viditaṃ padayor dvayaṃ te tasmai namo 'stu mahasāṃ pataye parasmai

column2: Śrī Nārada said: One day, seeing that many great calamities had come, Nanda called his friends: the Vṛṣabhānus, the Upanandas, and other elders, and in the assembly he said to them, Please tell what should be done. Many calamities have come to Mahāvana.

column2: He circumambulated it, and then returned to his own abode. I have now told you about Mathurā Vraja maṇòala, which I personally saw break the earth's pride. What more do you wish to hear?

column2: Śrī Varāha said: O beautiful one, you see transcendental Mathurā maṇòala, which is part of the realm of Goloka, and is not destroyed at the time of cosmic devastation.

O king, the demon circumambulated Kṛṣṇa and Balarāma, and then, filling the circle of the directions with light, he ascended the chariot and went to Goloka, far beyond the material realm.

column2: O king of Mithilā, as everyone watched, King Vṛṣabhānu took ten million necklaces of giant pearls, each pearl splendid as ten million glittering crowns, placed them in many jewel caskets, and had many handsome men take them to King Nanda with a proposal for his son's marriage.

column1: nanda rāja sabhāṃ gatvā vṛṇānāḥ kuśalāḥ bhṛśāṃ nidhāya dāma pātrāṇi nandam āhuḥ praṇamya tam
column2: Entering King Nanda's assembly, bowing down, and presenting the caskets of pearls, the handsome men bearing the marriage proposal spoke to Nanda.

column2: The men bearing a marriage proposal said: Aware that his daughter Rādhā, who is splendid as ten million moons and whose eyes are like new lotus flowers, is now old enough to be married, King Vṛṣabhānu has given some thought to who should be Her husband. He has decided on your son, who is charming as Kāmadeva himself, and whose powerful arm lifted Govardhana Hill. O master, O king of the vaiśyas, seeing us, glorious King Vṛṣabhānu sent us with this message.

column1: varasya cāìke bharaṇāya pūrvaṃ muktā phalānāṃ nicayaṃ gṛhāṇaitaś ca kanyārtham alaṃ pradehi saiṣā hi cāsmāt kulajā prasiddhiḥ
column2: Please accept these pearls as a wedding gift. Please give a similar gift to this girl. She is very respectable and glorious.

column2: Śrī Nārada said: Gazing at the precious gift, Nanda became filled with wonder. Thinking to ask Yaśodā if they had anything equal to that gift, he went to the palace's inner rooms.

column2: Observing that Nanda and Yaśodā thought they had nothing suitable to give in return, Lord Kṛṣṇa, the savior from distress, took one hundred of the pearl necklaces and, with His own hand, planted the pearls one by one as if He were a farmer planting grains.

column1: atha nando 'pi gaṇayan kalikā nicayaṃ punaḥ śataṃ nyūnaṃ ca tad dṛṣṭvā sandehaṃ sa jagāma ha

column1: tatra muktā phālānāṃ tu śākhinaḥ śataśaḥ śubhāḥ dṛśyate dīrgha vapuṣo harit pallava śobhitāḥ
column2: There they saw hundreds of beautiful, tall, green leaved pearl trees.

column2: Śrī Nārada said: O king, Vṛndāvana forest and Govardhana Hill, which is the crown of Goloka, are both worshiped as the best of holy places.

column1: indra yāgaṃ vinirbhartsya sarvair nija janaiḥ sahayat pūjanaṃ samārebhe bhagavān bhuvaneśvaraḥ

column1: 22 and 23ṛṣyamūkasya sahyasya tathā deva gireḥ punaḥ yātrāyāṃ labhate puṇyaṃ samastāya bhuvaḥ phalamgirirājasya yātrāyāṃ tasmāt koṭi guṇaṃ phalamgirirāja samaṃ tīrthaṃ na bhūtaṃ na bhaviṣyati
column2: By going on pilgrimage to Govardhana Hill one attains piety ten million times greater than the piety he would attain by going on pilgrimage to Ṛṣyamūka or Devagiri. There never was, nor will there ever be a holy place equal to Govardhana Hill.

column1: 24 and 25śrī śaile daśa varṣāni kuṇòe vidyādhare naraḥ snānaṃ karoti sukṛtī śata yajña phalaṃ labhetgovardhane pucche kuṇòe dinaikaṃ snāna kṛn naraḥ koṭi yajña phalaṃ sākṣāt puṇyam eti na saṃśayaḥ

column1: 26 and 27veìkatādrau vāri dhāre mahendre vindhya parvateyajñāṃ kṛtvā hy aśvamedhaṃ naro nāka patir bhavetgovardhane 'smin yo yajñaṃ kṛtvā dattvā su dakṣiṇāmnāke padaṃ samvidhāya sa viṣṇoḥ padam āvrajet

That pious result is multiplied ten million times by visiting Bhārata varṣa. It is multiplied unlimited times by visiting Govardhana Hill.

column2: The gopīs that decorate the forest groves said: We still see the marks Kṛṣṇa left in the forest groves of mādhavī vines and maddened buzzing bees. We still hear the stories of His pastimes.

column1: śrī nikuñja vāsinya ūcuḥ vṛndāvane matta milinda puñje kalindajā tīra kadamba kuñjeśanais calantam sa balam sa gopaṃ sa godhanam nanda sutam bhajāmaḥ
column2: The gopīs that stayed in the forest said: We worship Kṛṣṇa who, accompanied by Balarāma, the gopas, and the cows, slowly walked by the Yamunā's shore in Vṛndāvana's kadamba forest filled with intoxicated bees.

column1: śrī jāhnavī yūtha uvāca kadā tathāsmat samayo bhaviṣyati yathā purandhrī samayaḥ pradṛśyateśokam param mā kuruta vrajāìganāḥ sadā na kasyāpi jayaḥ parājayaḥ
column2: The group of gopīs headed by Śrī Jāhnavī said: O girls of Vraja, don't lament, saying, “Now is the time for the girls of Mathura' City. When will our time come? The winner and the loser there will always be.

column1: śrī yamunā yūtha uvāca vidhātur na dayā kiñcid yunakti viyunakti yaḥ bhūtāni sakalāny eva krīòanāni yathārbhakaḥ
column2: The group of gopīs headed by Śrī Yamuna' said: The creator Brahma' is not kind. He joins and separates the living entities like a child playing with toys.

column1: śrī ramā yūtha uvāca kubjā purādyarju samāna vigrahā dāsī tṭ idānīm tu kulīnatām gatāku rūpiṇī rūpavatī babhāṭ aho catur dinair dundubhi nāda kāriṇī
column2: The group of gopīs headed by Śrī Rama' said: The girl Kubja' was crooked and now she is straight. She was a lowly maidservant and now she is exalted and worthy of honor. She was ugly and now she is beautiful. For her the victory drums sounded for four days.

column1: śrī vijayā yūthā ūcuḥ sadā na kasyāpi bhujā priyāṃse sadā vasanto na sadā yuvā syātindro na rājyam kurute sadāyaṃ catur dinair mānam alaìkarotu
column2: The groups of gopīs headed by Śrī Vijaya' said: The arm is not on the beloved's shoulder eternally. Springtime is not eternal. Youth is not eternal. Indra does not rule his kingdom eternally. For four days Kubja' was glorified.

column1: śrī lalitā yūtha uvāca rāsābhiṣekam vinivārya mantharā cakāra vighnam kila kosale purekubjaiva seyam mathurā pure gatā kubjaiva kim kim na karoti gopikāḥ
column2: The groups of gopīs headed by Śrī Lalita' said: The girl Kubja' in Mathura' City had been Manthara' in Ayodhyā, where she stopped the coronation of Lord Rāmacandra. O gopīs, what offense had Kubja' not committed?

column1: śrī viśākhā yūtha uvāca go cāraṇāyānucarair vrajantaṃ prabodhayantam sva puram virāvaiḥ mattebha yānam hi viòambayantaṃ śrī nanda sūnum na hi vismarāmaḥ
column2: The groups of gopīs headed by Śrī Viśākha' said: We have not forgotten Nanda's son, Kṛṣṇa, who wakened the entire village with the great clamor He made as He went with His friends to herd the cows, His walking mocking the graceful steps of intoxicated elephants.

column1: śrī māyā yūtha uvāca saìkoca vīthiṣu pate pragṛhya prasahya dorbhyām hṛdaye nidhāyaanyonyam ākarṣaṇa harṣa bhītir gṛhān harim tam hi kadā nayāmaḥ
column2: The groups of gopīs headed by Śrī Māya' said: When will we ambush Kṛṣṇa on the narrow path and with both arms forcibly hold Him to our hearts? When, happy and frightened, will we take Him to our homes?

column1: śrī aṣṭa sakhya ūcuḥ vīkṣya nanda sutam aìga sundaraṃ netram adya na jagad vipaśyatinanda rāja tanaye purīm sthite kim bhaviṣyati vadāśu nas tvaram
column2: The eight gopī friends said: Today our eyes see only the handsome son of King Nanda and they cannot see anything of the material world. Now that Kṛṣṇa is in Mathura' City, what will happen next? O gentle Uddhava, please tell us at once.

column1: śrī ṣoòaśa sakhya ūcuḥ veṇu nāda madhura dhvanim vane sanniśamya kusumeṣu vardhanamśrotra yugmam iha naḥ śṛṇoti no viśva gītam uta vā yaśaḥ param
column2: The sixteen gopī friends said: When they hear the sweet musaī of Kṛṣṇa's flute in the forest, our ears cannot hear any other musī in the entire world. Our ears do not think any other musī is sweet and glorious.

column1: śrī dvatriṃśat sakhya ūcuḥ prītyā sva mitram hi ripum nayena lubdham dhanais ca dvijam ādareṇagurum praṇāmai rasikam rasena nirmohinam kena vaśī karoti
column2: The thirty two gopī friends said: With love one makes a friend into a submissive servant. With superior logī one makes a friend into a submissive servant. With money one makes a greedy miser into a submissive servant. With worship and honor one makes a brāhmaṇa into a submissive servant. With bowing down again and again one makes a guru into a submissive servant. With beautiful things sweet as nectar one makes a person searching after nectar into a submissive servant. With what does one make a person who can never be bewildered into a submissive servant?

column1: śrī śruti rūpā ūcuḥ yaê jāgarādiṣu bhaveṣu param hy ahetur hetusvid asya vicaranti guṇās ca yenanaitad viśanti mahad indriya deva saìghās tasmai namo 'gnim iva viṣṭrta visphuliìgāḥ
column2: The gopīs that had been Personified Vedas said: We offer our respectful obeisances to Lord Kṛṣṇa, the Supreme Personality of Godhead. He is the cause of wakefulness, dream, and sleep, but nothing outside of Himself is the cause of Him. Pushed by Him, the modes of material nature act. The mahat tattva, senses, and demigods have no power over Him. He is a blazing fire and all things that exist are sparks from Him.

column1: śrī devāìganā ūcuḥ aṃśāṃśakāṃśaka kālādy avatāra vṛndair āveśa pūrṇa sahitās ca parasya yasyasargādayaḥ kila bhavanti tam eva kṛṣṇaṃ pūrṇāt param tu paripūrṇatamam natāḥ smaḥ
column2: The gopīs that had been demigoddesses said: The aṃśa, aṃśāṃśa, kalā, āveśa, pūrṇa, and other incarnations of Godhead come from Him. The creation, maintenance, and destruction of the material universes come from Him. We bow down before Him, Śrī Kṛṣṇa, the original Supreme Personality of Godhead, more perfect than the perfect.

column1: śrī ramā vaikuṇṭha vāsinya ūcuḥ yo gopikā sakala yūtham alañcakāra vṛndāvanam ca nija pāda rajobhir adrimyaḥ sarva loka vibhavāya babhūva bhūmau tam bhūri līlam uragendra bhujam bhajāmaḥ
column2: The gopīs that had been residents of Rama' Vaikuṇṭha said: We worship Lord Kṛṣṇa, whose arms are like two snake kings, who decorated Vṛndāvana, Govardhana Hill, and all the gopīs with the dust of His feet, and who to show His glories to all the worlds enjoyed many transcendental pastimes on the earth.

column1: śrī śvetadvīpa sakhī janā ūcuḥ yathā śilīndhram śiśur āśramo gajaḥ sva puṣkareṇaiva ca puṣkaram girimdhṛtvā babhau śrī vraja rāja nandanaḥ kṛpākaro 'sau na hi vismṛtaḥ kvacit
column2: The gopīs that had been friends of the goddess of fortune on Śvetadvīpa said: We have not forgotten compassionate Śrī Kṛṣṇa, the prince of Vraja, who, as a child lifts a mushroom or an elephant lifts a lotus in its tongue, lifted Govardhana Hill.

column1: śrī ūrdhva vaikuṇṭha vāsinya ūcuḥ śyāma varṇamaye netre jagā chyāmam vipaśyataḥ na dvaitam dṛśyate yāsāṃ tābhiḥ kim yoga sevanam
column2: The gopīs that had been residents of Urdhva Vaikuṇṭha said: When the eyes are covered with darkness they see the entire universe is dark. In that darkness, the eyes can clearly see that everything is all one and there is no duality. What use do we have for this darkness of impersonalist yoga?

column1: śrī lokācala vāsinya ūcuḥ sneha pāśo dṛòho chinno na cchinno hariṇā vināchittvā tam mathurām prāgān nāga pāsam yathā khagaḥ
column2: The gopīs that had been residents of Lokācala said: Only Kṛṣṇa can cut the noose of love. No one but Him can cut it. As Garuòa cuts a noose of snakes, Kṛṣṇa should have cut the noose of our love before He went to Mathura' City.

column1: śrī ajita padāśritā ūcuḥ kṛṣṇe lagnam netra yugmaṃ dhāvad daśa diśāntaramaho na lagnam kutrāpi padma lagno yathā hy aliḥ
column2: The gopīs that had taken shelter of Lord Ajita's feet said: Not going anywhere else in the ten directions, our eyes rest on Kṛṣṇa as a bumblebee rests on a lotus.

column1: śrī sakhya ūcuḥ kārpaṇyena yaśo hanti krudhā guṇa gaṇodayamdhanāni vyasanair lokaḥ kapaṭenaiva mitratām
column2: The gopīs that had been friends of the goddess of fortune said: Being in a wretched condition destroys one's fame. Anger destroys virtues. Misfortune destroys wealth. Treachery destroys friendship.

column1: śrī maithilā ūcuḥ dhanam dattvā tanum rakṣet tanum dattvā trapām vyadhātdhanam tanum trapām dadyān mitra kāryārtham eva hi
column2: The gopīs that had been the women of Mithila' said: By paying money one may protect his body, and by renouncing this body one may preserve his good reputation. For the sake of a friend one may give away his money, body, and good reputation.

column1: śrī kauśalā ūcuḥ na ko 'pi jānāti viyoga jām dāsāṃ jīvam vinā vaktum alam na sāpi hibhūyād uro bāṇa bhinnam ārān mābhūt kadāpi priya viprayojanam
column2: The gopīs that had been women of Kośala said: Only a person whose heart has been broken by the arrow of separation can understand or describe the sufferings of a lover separated from the beloved.

column1: śrī ayodhyā pura vāsinya ūcuḥ kṛtvā nirāśām vinidhāya cāśāṃ jagāma cāśām mathurā purasyayogam ca tasyopari cālikhan no nirmohinām cittam aho vicitram
column2: The gopīs that had been the women of Ayodhya' said: First He gave us no hope, then He gave us hope, then he went to Mathura' City. Now He writes that we will meet again. Are not the hearts of they who do not love wonderful to see?

column1: śrī pulindikā ūcuḥ enam varam kartum atīva vihvalāṃ samāgatām śūrpanakhām purā vaneyaḥ kārayām āsa virūpiṇīm balāt saumitriṇā tena tu vaḥ kṛpā katham
column2: The gopīs that had been Pulindās said: When Śūrpaṇakha' fell in love with Him and yearned to marry Him, He made Lakṣmaṇa disfigure her. He was not kind then. Why should He be kind now?

column1: śrī sutala vāsinya ūcuḥ bhaktam balim satya param ca bhūr idaṃ nītvā balim yaḥ kupito babandha haaho katham tasya karoti sevanaṃ māyā baṭor vāmana rūpa dhāriṇaḥ
column2: The gopīs that had been the women of Sutalaloka said: When the sincere devotee Bali Mahārāja offered Him the entire world, Kṛṣṇa became angry and tightly bound Bali with many ropes. That is the result of worshiping Him. Why would anyone worship this person, who deviously pretended to be a brahmacārī?

column1: śrī jālandharya ūcuḥ purāti kaṣṭam pragate 'surottame kāyādhave bhakta vare tato hy ayambhūtvā nṛsiṃhaḥ kṛtavān sahāyaṃ aho parā niṣṭhuratā pradṛśyate
column2: The gopīs that had been Jālandharīs said: When the great demon Hiraṇyakaśipu tortured the great devotee Prahlāda, Kṛṣṇa appeared as Nṛsiṃha, saved Prahlāda, and was very cruel to Hiraṇyakaśipu.

column1: śrī bhūmi gopya ūcuḥ aho 'ti nirmohi janasya citraṃ param caritram gaditum na yogyammukhena cānyad dhṛdi bhāvyam anyad devo na jānāti kuto manuṣyaḥ
column2: The Bhūmi gopīs said: No one can describe with his mouth or understand with his heart the surprising activities of Kṛṣṇa, who is never bewildered by feelings of love. If even the great demigods cannot understand His activities, how can mere human beings understand them?

column1: śrī barhiṣmatī bhavā ūcuḥ aho layābdhau kṛpayā harir yaṃ uddhṛtya vārāha tanur mahātmātam anvadhāvad dhṛta siñjinī śaro bhūtvā dayāluḥ pṛthur ādi rājaḥ
column2: The gopīs that had been the women of Barhiṣmatī pura said: Kṛṣṇa was Varāha, who rescued the earth from the waters of devastation. Kṛṣṇa was the great and merciful king Pṛthu who, placing an arrow on His bowtsring, protected the earth.

column1: śrī latā gopya ūcuḥ svayam sudhām vā na vibhajya pūrvaṃ dhanvantarir viśva bhiṣān mahātmātad baddha vaireṣu surāsureṣu bhūtvātha yoṣit pradadau kali priyaḥ
column2: The gopīs that had been flowering vines said: In ancient times Kṛṣṇa became Dhanvantari the universal physician who brought, but did not distribute, nectar. When the demigods and demons quarreled, Kṛṣṇa, who sometimes likes a quarrel, became the girl Mohinī and gave the nectar to the demigods.

column1: śrī nāgendra kanyā ūcuḥ athecchatīm enam aho varam hariḥ samāgatām śūrpaṇakhām mahāvanecakāra saumitra sakhaḥ kurūpiṇīṃ aho kṛtam tasya tayā kim apriyam
column2: The gopīs that had been snake princesses said: When Kṛṣṇa was Rāmacandra, and Śūrpaṇakha' wished to marry Him, Rāmacandra, the friend of Lakṣmaṇa, disfigured her. What bad thing did she do to deserve that punishment?

column1: śrī samudra kanyā ūcuḥ nityam gṛha śatam yānti dātrī duḥ kham sukham janānsvīyā katham suśīlā ca cañcalāsmin katham sthitā
column2: The gopīs that had been daughters of the ocean said: Why does Kṛṣṇa's saintly beloved, the goddess of fortune, bring happiness or suffering to hundreds of homes every day? Why, even though she is rstless and fickle, does she always stay by His side?

column1: śrī apsara ūcuḥ asya prītyā karṇa nāse gate vai rāvaṇa svasuḥ tyajantu vārtām tenāpi bhavatīnām kṛpā kṛtā
column2: The gopīs that had been apsarās said: Śūrpaṇakha' lovingly approached Him and He responded by cutting off her ears and nose. Kṛṣṇa is not kind.

column1: śrī divyā ūcuḥ sarveśvaro balim nītvā balim baddhvā dayā paraḥ adhaḥ kṣipan mukti nāthas citram tat kathayābhavat
column2: The divya gopīs said: Even though Kṛṣṇa is the merciful Supreme Personality of Godhead, He tied up Bali Mahārāja, who was making an offering to Him. Even though Kṛṣṇa is the master that gives liberation, He threw Bali down to the lower worlds. This is all very surprising.

column1: śrī ādivyā ūcuḥ śatarūpā yutam śāntaṃ tapasy antam manum purādaityair badham gatam paścād rarakṣāsau dayā nidhiḥ
column2: The ādivya gopīs said: Kṛṣṇa protected Manu and Śatarūpa' when, as they were peacefully performing austerities, the demons attacked them.

column1: śrī sattva vṛttaya ūcuḥ pūrvam kaṣṭa gatam bhaktaṃ dhruvam kāyādhavam ca vaipaścād rarakṣa kṛpayā na pūrvam dīna vatsalaḥ
column2: The sattva vṛtti gopīs said: Although Kṛṣṇa, who is kind to the distressed, protected Dhruva and Prahlāda from many calamities, now He will not protect us..

column1: śrī rajo vṛttaya ūcuḥ rukmāìgada hariścandrām barīṣāṇām satām hariḥ satyam parīkṣan pradadau punar bhāgavatīm śriyam
column2: The rajo vṛtti gopīs said: When He saw that they were His sincere devotees, Lord Kṛṣṇa gave His own transcendental opulences to Rukmāìgada, Hariścandra, and Ambarīṣa.

column1: śrī tamo vṛttaya ūcuḥ vṛndā yena chalam prāptā chalinā balinā purāchalamayyā balinyādyā kubjayā chalito hy ayam
column2: The tamo vṛtti gopīs said: Kṛṣṇa cheated many others in the past. He cheated Bali Mahārāja and He also cheated Kubjā.

column1: kṛpāṇī hy ekato vakrā ghātayantī janān bahūnkim u kubjā tri vakrā ca śrī kṛṣṇena tri bhaìginā
column2: A single crooked sword can kill many straight people. Why, then, would Kṛṣṇa, who is Himself bent in three places, not cheat Kubjā, who was also crooked in three places?

column1: paśyantīnām kṛṣṇa mārgaṃ netre duḥ kham gate bhṛśamavadhīḥ pāda vīkṣepaṃ vāmanasya karoti hi
column2: Hoping for Kṛṣṇa to come, we stared at the path, trying to look as far as possible into the distance, even up to the place where Lord Vāmana kicked a hole in the covering of the universe.

column1: pītatvam tvag gatā pādau śaithilyam pragatau ca naḥ mano vibhramatām ugraṃ mādhave mādhavam vinā
column2: In Kṛṣṇa's absence our skin has turned yellow, our steps are unsteady, and our thoughts disoriented.

column1: sapatnī hāra cihnāòhyaṃ āgatam tam uṣaḥ kṣaṇeha daiva kasmin samaye drakṣyāmo nanda nandanam
column2: O destiny, when will we again see Nanda's son, bearing the marks and necklace of our rival as he comes to us at dawn?

column1: śrī nārada uvāca iti kṛṣṇam cintayantyo gopībhiḥ prema vihvalāḥ utkaṇṭhitās tā rurudur mūrchitā dhāraṇīm gatāḥ
column2: Śrī Nārada said: Thinking of Kṛṣṇa in this way, the gopīs became overwhelmed with love for Kṛṣṇa. Yearning to meet Him again, they wept, and then they fell unconscious to the ground.

column1: pṛthak pṛthak samāśvāsya vacobhir naya naipuṇaiḥ sambodhya gopikā sarvāḥ prāha rādhām tadoddhavaḥ
column2: After reviving all the gopīs and comforting each one with eloquent words, Uddhava spoke to Rādhā.

column1: śrī uddhava uvāca paripūrṇatame kṛṣṇe vṛṣabhānu varātmajegantum ājñām dehi mahyaṃ namas tubhyam vrajeśvari
column2: Śrī Uddhava said: O supreme goddess, O most exalted one, O daughter of King Vṛṣabhānu, please give me permission to depart. O queen of Vraja, I offer my respectful obeisances to You.

column1: pratipatram dehi śubhe śrī kṛṣṇāya mahātmanetena tam ca praṇamyāśu samāneṣye tavāntikam
column2: O beautiful one, please give me a letter for Śrī Kṛṣṇa, the Supreme Personality of Godhead. I will bow down before Him and then I will bring Him to You at once.

column1: śrī nārada uvāca atha rādhā lekhanīm ca nītvā patram maṣes tvaraṃsamācāram cintayanti tāvad aśrūni suśruvuḥ
column2: Śrī Nārada said: Then Rādha' took a pen and a jar of ink. As She thought of what to write, tears flowed from Her eyes.

column1: yad yat patram samānītaṃ rādhayā lekhanī yutamtat tad ardrī kṛtam jātaṃ nayanāmbuja vāribhiḥ
column2: Whatever Rādha' wrote with Her pen was at once washed away by the tears from Her eyes.

column1: aśru pravāham muñcantīṃ kṛṣṇa darśana lālasāmuddhavo vismayan prāha rādhām kamala locanām
column2: Filled with wonder, Uddhava spoke to lotus eyed Rādha' who, yearning to see Kṛṣṇa, shed streams of tears.

column1: śrī uddhava uvāca katham likhasi rādhe tvaṃ katham duḥ kham karoṣi hisarvam tasmai vadiṣyāmi vyathām tval lekhanam vinā
column2: Śrī Uddhava said: O Rādhā, why must You write? Why must You be unhappy in this way? Even without You writing a letter, I will tell Kṛṣṇa everything of Your distress.

column1: śrī nārada uvāca iti śrutvā vacas tasya rādhayā gata bādhayāsarvābhir gopikābhis ca pūjito 'bhūt tadoddhavaḥ
column2: Śrī Nārada said: Hearing these words, Rādha' became relieved. Then all the gopīs worshiped Uddhava.

column1: natvā pradakṣiṇī kṛtya rādhām rāseśvarīm paramgopī gaṇam anujñāpya natvā natvā punaḥ punaḥ
column2: Then He bowed down before Śrī Rādhā, the queen of the rāsa dance, and then He circumambulated Her. Then He bowed down again and again and again and again before all the gopīs and asked them for permission to depart.

column1: ratham āruhya divyābhaṃ ratna bhūṣaṇa bhūṣitamgata bhṛtyābhimāno 'sau sandhyāyām nandam āyayau
column2: Mounting his splendid jewel chariot, and his pride in being a great servant of Lord Kṛṣṇa now gone, Uddhava came at sunrise to Nanda's home.

column1: mārtaṇòa udayam prāpte natvā gopīm yaśomatīmnanda rājam anujñāpya nava nandāṃs tadoddhavaḥ
column2: As the sun rose, uddhava bowed down before the gopī Yaśoda, King Nanda, and the nine Nandas. Then Uddhava asked for permission to depart.

column1: vṛṣabhānūpanandāṃs ca samanujñāpya lokataḥ tathā kṛṣṇa sakhīn sarvān ratham āruhya nirgataḥ
column2: Taking permission from the Vṛṣabhānus, the Upanandas, and all of Lord Kṛṣṇa's friends, Uddhava mounted his chariot and left.

column1: dūram tam anugāḥ sarve gopā gopī gaṇās tathāsa nivṛttyātha tān snehād uddhavo mathurām yayau
column2: The gopas and gopī followed him for a long time. Then, out of love for them leaving them behind, Uddhava went to Mathurā.

column1: ekānte cākṣaya vaṭe kṛṣṇā tīre manoharenatvā kṛṣṇam parikramya prema gadgadayā girā prāha sravan netra padma uddhavo buddhi sattamaḥ
column2: Under an immortal banyan tree by the Yamunā's beautiful shore, Uddhava bowed down and before Lord Kṛṣṇa and then circumambulated Him. Tears flowing from his lotus eyes, Uddhava, the best of the wise, spoke in a voice choked with love.

column1: śrī uddhava uvāca kim deva kathanīyam me bhavato 'śeṣa sākṣiṇaḥ vidhatsva śam rādhikāyā gopīnām dehi darśanam
column2: Śrī Uddhava said: O Lord, what can I say to You, the witness that sees everything? Please give happiness to Rādha' and the gopīs. Please allow them to see You.

column1: śrī kṛṣṇam deva deveśaṃ samāneṣye tavāntikamittham vākyam ca me bhūtaṃ rakṣa rakṣa kṛpā nidhe
column2: I said to Rādhā, “I will bring Lord Kṛṣṇa, the master of the masters of the demigods, to You. O ocean of mercy, please protect, protect my words.

column1: prahlāda rukmāìgadayoḥ pratijñāṃ bales ca khatvaìga nṛpasya sākṣātyathāmbarīṣa dhruvayos tathā me kṛtā ca bhakteśvara rakṣa rakṣa

column1: hatvā tam śambaram śatruṃ bhāryayā varayā yutaḥ dvārakām āyayau rājaṃs citram karma ca tasya tat
column2: O king, after killing his enemy Śambara, Pradyumna went with his beautiful wife to Dvārakā. His deeds are certainly very wonderful.

column1: sa rukmiṇo duhitaraṃ hṛtvā bhojakaṭāt purātsvayamvara sthalād rājann upayeme mahā rathaḥ
column2: The great chariot fighter Pradyumna also kidnapped Rukmī's daughter from the place of her svayamvara in Bhojakaṭa City and married her.

column1: tasmāt suto 'niruddho 'bhūn nāgāyuta balānvitaḥ sura jyeṣṭhāvatāro 'yaṃ śāradendīvara prabhaḥ
column2: From Pradyumna was born a son, Aniruddha, who was strong as ten thousand elephants and glorious as a blue autumn lotus. He was an incarnation of the first of the demigods.

column1: catur vyūhāvatārasya paripūrṇatamasya hievam vicitram caritaṃ vivāhānām su maìgalam
column2: This is the wonderful and auspicious story of the marriages of Lord Kṛṣṇa, the origin of the catur vyūha expansions of the Lord.

column1: sarva pāpa haram puṇyaṃ āyur vardhanam uttamammayā te kathitam rājan kim bhūyaḥ śrotum icchasi
column2: O king, now I have spoken to you this sacred story, which removes all sins and increases one's span of life. What more do you wish to hear?

column1: śrī bahulāśva uvāca triṣu lokeṣu vikhyātā dhanyā vai dvārakā purīparipūrṇatamaḥ sākṣāc chrī kṛṣṇo yatra vāsa kṛt
column2: Śrī Bahulāśva said: Glorious Dvāraka' City is famous in the three worlds. Śrī Kṛṣṇa, the original Supreme Personality of Godhead, resides there.

column1: śrī kṛṣṇasyāìga sambhūtā purī dvāravatī śrutākasmād ihāgatā brahman kasmin kāle vada prabho
column2: I have heard that Dvāraka' City was manifested from Lord Kṛṣṇa's transcendental body. How and when did it come to this earth? O master, please tell.

column1: śrī nārada uvāca sādhu sādhu tvayā pṛṣṭaṃ dvārakāgama kāraṇamyā chrutvā śuddhatām yāti loka ghāty api pātakī
column2: Śrī Nārada said: Excellent. You have asked an excellent question. By hearing the reason for Dvārakā's arrival on this earth, even a great sinner, or even a murderer becomes pure at heart.

column1: śaryātir nāma rājābhūc cakravartī manoḥ sutaḥ cakāra rājyam dharmeṇa varṣānām ayutam bhuvi
column2: There was a king named Śaryāti who for ten thousand years ruled the earth according to religious principles.

column1: uttānabarhir ānarto bhūriṣeṇa iti trayaḥ śaryāter abhavan putrāḥ sarva dharma bhṛtām varāḥ
column2: Śaryāti had three very pious sons sons: Uttānabarhi, Anarta, and Bhūriṣeṇa.

column1: uttānabarhiṣe purvāṃ bhūriṣeṇāya dakṣiṇāmpaścimām ca diśam sarvāṃ ānartāya dadau nṛpaḥ
column2: To Uttānabarhi King Śaryāti gave the eastern part of his kingdom, to Bhūriṣeṇa he gave the southern part, and to Anarta he gave the western part.

column1: mameyam hi mahī kṛtsnā mayā dharmeṇa pālitābalārjitā baliṣṭhena yūyam tam pālayiṣyatha
column2: King Śaryāti said to them: This entire earth is mine. I rule and protect it according to religious principles. I am most powerful. I have conquered this earth by my own power. In the future you three will also rule and protect this earth.

column1: pitur vacaḥ samākarṇya ānarto madhyamaḥ sutaḥ jñānī jñānamayam vākyaṃ uvāca prahasann iva
column2: Hearing his father's words, the middle son, Anarta, who was very wise, laughed and spoke words of great wisdom.

column1: śrī ānarta uvāca taveyam na mahī kṛtsnā na tvayā pālitā kvacitna tvad balārjitā rājan baliṣṭho bhagavān vibhuḥ
column2: Śrī Anarta said: You do not own this earth. Nor do you rule and protect it. Nor did you conquer it with your own power. Only the Supreme Personality of Godhead is the all powerful ruler of this earth.

column1: mahī śrī kṛṣṇadevasya tenaiva paripālitātat tejasā jitā kṛtsnā baliṣṭho na hareḥ samaḥ
column2: The earth is Lord Kṛṣṇa's property. He rules and protects it. He conquered it with His great power. No one is powerful like Lord Kṛṣṇa.

column1: sa eva viśvam sva kṛtaṃ sṛjaty atti ca pāti casa eva brahma paramaṃ kālaḥ kalayatām prabhuḥ
column2: He creates, maintains, and destroys this universe. He is the Supreme Brahman. He is time, the master of all that subdue.

column1: yo 'ntaḥ praviśya bhūtāni bhūtair apy akhilāśrayaḥ sa viśvākhyo 'dhiyajño 'sau paripūrṇatamaḥ svayam
column2: He has entered within all living entities and all elements. He is the shelter and resting place of all living entities and all elements. He is the entire universe. He is the object of all sacrifices. He is the most perfect Supreme Personality of Godhead.

column1: yad bhayād vati vāto 'yaṃ sūryas tapati yad bhayātyad bhayād varṣate devo mṛtyuś carati yad bhayāt
column2: Out of fear of Him the wind blows. Out of fear of Him the sun shines. Out of fear of Him Indra gives rain. Out of fear of Him death moves on the earth.

column2: O king, please become free from pride and false ego and with all your heart worship Śrī Kṛṣṇa, the Supreme Personality of Godhead.

column1: śrī nārada uvāca jñānam prāpto 'pi śaryātir ākṣiptaḥ putra vāk śaraiḥ ānartam sva sutam prāha ruṣā prasphuritādharaḥ
column2: Wounded by the arrows of his son's words, and his lips trembling in anger even though what he was confronted with was the truth, Śaryāti spoke to his son Anarta.

column1: śaryātir uvāca dūram gaccha asad buddhe guruvad bhāṣase kathamyāvad bhūtam tu me rājyaṃ tāvat tvam me mahīm vasa
column2: Śaryāti said: Fool, get out! Why do you talk as if you were my teacher? You may not live any place in my kingdom.

column1: yas tvayārādhitaḥ kṛṣṇaḥ so 'pi sarva sahāya kṛtna navīnām kim mahīm te bhagavān eva dāsyati
column2: Take help from this Kṛṣṇa you worship. Will He not give you some new land not now a part of the earth?

column2: Śrī Nārada said: Addressed in this way, respectful Anarta said to the king, I will not live anywhere in your kingdom, which extends to all the countries of the earth.

column1: pitrā niḥ sārito rājñāpy ānarto 'bdhi taṭam gataḥ velām etya tapas tepe varṣānām ayutam jale
column2: Banished by his father, Anarta went to the seacoast and entered the ocean, where he performed austerities for ten thousand years.

column1: prema lakṣaṇayā bhaktyā santuṣṭo bhagavān hariḥ tasmai svam darśanam dattvā varam brūhīty uvāca ha
column2: Pleased by his loving devotion, Lord Kṛṣṇa appeared before him and said, Ask for a boon.

column1: kṛtāñjali puṭo bhūtvā narta utthāya śīghrataḥ nanāma kṛṣṇa pādābjaṃ romāñcī prema vihvalaḥ
column2: Overcome with love, and the hairs of his body erect with joy, Anarta quickly stood up and with folded hands bowed before Lord Kṛṣṇa's lotus feet.

column1: pitrā niṣkāsito deva tvām aham śaraṇam gataḥ dehi mahyam bhūmim anyāṃ yatra vāso hi me bhavet
column2: I, who was banished by my father, now take shelter of You. O Lord, please give me a country where I may reside, a country outside my father's kingdom of the earth.

column1: dhruvo 'pi yat prasādena yayau sarvottamam padamtasmai namo bhagavate praṇata kleśa hāriṇe
column2: I offer my respectful obeisances to the Supreme Personality of Godhead, who removes the sufferings of the surrendered souls and who mercifully gave to Dhruva Mahārāja the best of all abodes.

column1: śrī nārada uvāca ānartam ānatam dīnaṃ bhagavān dīna vatsalaḥ prasannaḥ śrī mukhenāha megha gambhīrayā girā
column2: Śrī Nārada said: Then the Supreme Personality of Godhead, who is kind to the downtrodden and who was pleased at heart, with His glorious mouth spoke words deep like thunder to poor Anarta, who was bowing down before Him.

column1: śrī bhagavān uvāca anyā na medinī loke kim kartavyam mayā nṛpasva vacas tad ṛtam kartuṃ tvad bhaktyā paritoṣitaḥ
column2: The Supreme Personality of Godhead said: I am pleased by Your devotion, but I I do not have another earth in this universe to give you. O king, what should I do to grant the boon you ask?

column1: tasmād vai svasya lokasya vaikuṇṭhasya parantapabhū khaṇòam yojana śataṃ dadāmi vimalam śubham
column2: Therefore, O mighty one, I will place on this earth an eight hundred mile portion of my pure and glorious Vaikuṇṭha world.

column1: 28 and 29 śrī nārada uvāca ity uktvānārta nṛpatiṃ bhagavān bhakta vatsalaḥ vaikuṇṭhāt ca samutpatya bhū khaṇòam śata yojanamcakram sudarśanam dhṛtvā samudre bhīma nādinidadhāra bhagavān devas tasyopari videha rāṭ
column2: Śrī Nārada said: O king of Videha, after speaking these words, the Supreme Personality of Godhead, who loves His devotees, took His Sudarśana cakra, lifted up an eight hundred mile portion of Vaikuṇṭha, and placed it in the ocean filled with fearful sounds.

column1: ānarto lakṣa varṣāntaṃ tatra rājyam cakāra haputra pautra samāyukto rājan vaikuṇṭha sampadam
column2: O king, in this way, after ten thousand years Anarta attained a kingdom with all the opulences of Vaikuṇṭha and a dynasty with many noble sons and grandsons.

column1: idam śrutvātha śaryātiḥ pitā vai vismito 'bhavatānarto nāma deśo 'bhūd ānartasya prasādataḥ
column2: By the Lord's mercy that country was named Anarta after him. When he heard all this, Anarta's father, Śaryāti, became astonished.

column1: revatas tasya putro 'bhūc chrī śailasya gireḥ sutamsamutpatya sva hastābhyāṃ ānarteṣu nyapātayat
column2: Anarta's son was named Revata. Revata lifted the mountain that was Mount Śaila's son and placed it in the country of Anarta.

column1: so 'bhūd revata nāmnāpi raivato nāma parvataḥ kuśasthalīm vinirmāya rājyam kṛtvātha revataḥ
column2: That mountain was named Raivata after him. Building a great capitol city named Kuśasthalī, Revata ruled the kingdom of Anarta.

column1: samādāya svakām kanyāṃ brahmalokam jagāma habaladeva vivāhe 'pi tat kathā kathitā mayā tasmād dvāravatīm puṇyām mokṣa dvāram viduḥ surāḥ
column2: Revata took his daughter to Brahmaloka. That I have alredy described in the story of her marriage to Lord Balarāma. The demigods know that the sacred city of Dvāraka' is the gateway to liberation.

column1: śrī nārada uvāca ittham mayā te kathitaṃ dvārakāgama kāraṇamsarva pāpa haram puṇyaṃ kim bhūyaḥ śrotum icchasi
column2: Śrī Nārada said: Thus I have told to you the story of how Dvāraka' came to the earth, a sacred story that remnoves all sins. What more do you wish to hear?

column1: śrī bahulāśva uvāca sarva tīrtha mayī bhūmir dvārakā nagarī śubhātatra mukhyāni tīrthāni vada mām muni sattama
column2: Śrī Bahulāśva said: All holy places are manifested in beautiful Dvāraka' City. O best of sages, please describe to me the most important of the holy places there.

column1: śrī nārada uvāca ā prabhāsāt tīrthamayī maryādī kṛtya yajñiyābhūmir mokṣa pradā rājan dvārakā yojanaiḥ śatam
column2: Śrī Nārada said: Extending all the way to Prabhāsa tīrtha, the sacred land of Dvāraka' is eight hundred miles in size.

column1: dvārakām nagarīm dṛṣṭvā naro naṛāyaṇo bhavetdvārakāyām mṛtaḥ ko 'pi gardabho 'pi catur bhujaḥ
column2: Anyone who sees Dvāraka' City attains opulences like Lord Nārāyaṇa. Even a donkey that dies in Dvāraka' becomes a four armed resident of Vaikuṇṭha.

column1: paśyan śṛṇvan kathām tasyā dvāraketi vadan kvacitdṛṣṭvā dadyāt tṛṇam mṛtyuṃ gato yāti parām gatim
column2: A person who sees Dvārakā, hears about it, or speaks the word Dvārakā, thinks everything else to be like a piece of straw. When he dies he attains the supreme destination.

column1: ekadā revatam bhaktaṃ premānanda samākulamprekṣya svam darśanam dattvā harir aśru mukho 'bhavat
column2: One day Lord Kṛṣṇa appeared before King Revata. Seeing that His devotee Revata was filled with the bliss of spiritual love, Lord Kṛṣṇa shed tears that glided down His face.

column1: tan netra bindu sambhūtā gomatī sa mahā nadīyasya darśana mātreṇa brahma hatyā pramucyate
column2: From one of the Lord's teardrops the great Gomatī river was created. Simply by seeing this river one becomes freed from the sin of killing a brāhmaṇa.

column1: gomatī tīrajam puṇyaṃ rajo yo dhārayen naraḥ śata janma kṛtāt pāpān mucyate nātra saṃśayaḥ
column2: A person who touches the sacred dust on the Gomatī's shore becomes free from the sins committed in a hundred births. Of this there is no doubt.

column1: snāna kāle gomatīti vadaty api naraḥ kvacitgomatyām snāna jam puṇyam labhate vai na saṃśayaḥ
column2: A person who, as he bathes, says the word Gomatī attains the pious result of bathing in the Gomatī. Of this there is no doubt.

column1: makara sthe ravau māghe prayāge snānam ācaretśatāśvamedhajam puṇyaṃ samprāpnoti videha rāṭ
column2: O king of Videha, a person who bathes at Prayāga in the month of Māgha (January February, when the sun is in Capricorn attains the pious result of performing a hundred aśvamedha yajñas.

column1: tat sahasra guṇam puṇyaṃ gomatyām makare ravaugomatyāś caiva māhātmyaṃ vaktum nālam catur mukhaḥ
column2: A person who bathes in the Gomatī at that time, when the sun is in Capricorn, attains a pious result a thousand times greater than that attained at Prayāga. Even the demigod Brahma' is not able to properly describe all the glories of the sacred Gomatī river.

column1: gomatyām cakra tīrtheṣu pāṣāṇa nicayaś ca yete sarve cakratām yānti pūjanīyāḥ prayatnataḥ
column2: By the Gomatī is a sacred place named Cakra tīrtha. All the stones there are incarnations of thr Lord's Sudarśana cakra. They should be worshiped with great care.

column1: cakra cihne cakra tīrthe dvādaśyām snānam ācaretcakrapāṇi padam yāti pāpānām bhājano 'pi hi
column2: A person, even though he is a great reservoir of sins, who on the dvādaśī day bathes at Cakra tīrtha, which bears the mark of the Lord's cakra, attains the abode of Lord Kṛṣṇa, who holds the cakra in His hand.

column1: koṭi janma kṛtaiḥ pāpaiḥ patito yo 'pi pātakīcakra tīrthasya sopānaṃ etya muktim samāruhet
column2: Degraded person who has sinned in many millions of births attains liberation if he comes to the steps of Cakra tīrtha.

column1: śrī bahulāśva uvāca gomatyām hi mahā nadyāṃ cakra tīrtham śubhārthadamkatham jātam bahu mataṃ tan me brūhi mahā mate
column2: Śrī Bahulāśva said: O noble hearted one, please tell me how Cakra tīrtha by the great Gomatī river became so glorious and beneficial.

column1: śrī nārada uvāca atraivodāharantīmaṃ itihāsam purātanaṃyasya darśana mātreṇa pāpa hāniḥ parā bhavet
column2: Śrī Nārada said: The sages tell an ancient story of how by simply seeing Cakra tīrtha one becomes free of all sins.

column1: alakeśo rāja rājo nidhīśo dharma bhṛt prabhuḥ vaiṣṇavam yajñam ārebhe kailāsottara bhūmiṣu
column2: There once was a great, pious, and wealthy king named Alakeśa, who performed a Viṣṇu yajña on the summit of Mount Kailāsa.

column1: 18 and 19 tasya yajñe svayam viṣṇur āgato vai sva dhāmataḥ brahmā śivo jambhabhedī varuṇo yadasām patiḥ vāyur yamo raviḥ somaḥ kṣitiḥ sarva janeśvarīgandharvāpsarasaḥ siddhāḥ sarve tatra samāyayuḥ
column2: Traveling from His own abode, Lord Viṣṇu personally came to his yajña, and Brahmā, Śiva, Indra, Varuṇa king of the waters, Vāyu, Yama, Sūrya, Candra, Kṣiti the earth goddess who rules all people, and all the Gandharvas, Apsarās, and Siddhas also came.

column1: devarṣayaḥ samājagmus tathā brahmarṣayo nṛpadhanādhyakṣo 'bhavat tasya putras te nalakūvaraḥ
column2: O king, the devarṣis and Brahmarṣis also came. Kuvera and his son Nalakūvara were also there.

column1: rakṣāyām vīrabhadro 'bhūt sevāyām ca gajānanaḥ tathā marud gaṇāḥ sarve pariveṣaṇa kāriṇaḥ
column2: Vīrabhadra was there as a guard. Gaṇeśa was there to render service. All the Maruts were there to serve meals.

column1: 22 and 23 bāhuleyaḥ sabhā pūjāṃ akarod dharma tat paraḥ ghaṇṭānādaḥ pārśvamauliḥ kuverasya tu mantriṇausarva śastra vidām śreṣṭhau dānādhyakṣau babhūvatuḥ evam hi vidhi vad yajño babhūva paramotsavaḥ
column2: Kārttikeya worshiped the assembly. Kuvera's two ministers, Ghaṇṭānāda and Pārśvamauli, who were very generous and most learned in the scriptures, were also there. In this way the yajña, carefully performed according to the rules and regulations, was a great and festive success.

column1: adhvarāvabhṛta snāto rāja rājo mahā manāḥ param bhāgam ca devebhyo viprebhyo dakṣiṇām adāt
column2: Having performed the avabhṛta bath, the noble hearted king gave sacrifical offerings to the demigods and dakṣiṇa' to the brāhmaṇas.

column1: evam pūrṇe 'dhvare mukhye tuṣṭe devarṣi sattameājagāmātha durvāsā daṇòī chatrī jaṭādharaḥ
column2: When the yajña was thus completed and the sages and demigods were all pleased, Durvāsa' Muni, holding a stick and a parasol, suddenly arrived.

column1: krodhī kṛṣaḥ pādukāìghrir dīrgha smaśruḥ kṛśodaraḥ darbhāsana samit pātra mṛga carma dharaḥ paraḥ
column2: His beard was long. He carried a kamaṇòalu and a kuśa grass seat. He wore sandals and a deerskin garment. He was very thin and emaciated, and he was very angry.

column1: tam āgatam samāgamya pūjayitvā vidhānataḥ bhaya bhītaḥ parikramya kuveraḥ praṇanāma ha
column2: Frightened, Kuvera approached him, worshiped him, circumambulated him, and bowed down before him.

column1: adya me sa phalam janma sa phalam mandiram ca meadya me sa phalo yajño brahmaṃs tvayy āgate sati
column2: Kuvera said: O brāhmaṇa, now that you have come here, my life is a success, my home is a success, and this yajñ)a is a success.

column1: ittham santoṣitas tena durvāsā bhagavān muniḥ devam manuṣya dharmāṇāṃ prāha prahasitānanaḥ
column2: Pleased by all this, the great sage Durvāsa' spoke about the religious duties of human beings.

column1: tvam rāja rājo dharmātmā dānī vipra parāyaṇaḥ kṛtas te vaiṣṇavo yajño viṣṇu santoṣa kāraṇaḥ
column2: He said: You are a great king. You are pious, generous, and devoted to the brāhmaṇas. Your yajña has pleased Lord Viṣṇu.

column1: na yācito mayā tvam vai kvāpi vaiśravaṇa prabhoadyaiva yacanam kurve jñātvā tvam dāni sattamam
column2: O Lord Kuvera, in the past I have never asked any favors of you, but today, aware that you are very generous by nature, I have a request to ask of you.

column1: mad yācñām sa phalī kuryās tubhyam dāsyāmi sad varamna cet tvam bhasmasāt kurve śāpenāti bhayena vai
column2: Please grant my request. If you do, I will give you a boon. If you do not, I will burn you to ashes with a frightening curse.

column1: vartante tvad gṛhe sarve trailokya nidhayo navātan me prayaccha bhadram te tad artham gatavān aham
column2: In your home you keep the nine treasures that are the most precious in the three worlds. Please give them to me. May your life be auspicious. For that purpose I have come.

column1: śrī nārada uvāca etā chrutvā rāja rājo dāna śīla udāra dhīḥ om iti pratigṛhṇīṣva prāha tam guhyakeśvaraḥ
column2: Śrī Nārada said: Hearing these words, generous and charitable Kuvera said, Yes. I agree. Please take them.

column1: evam nidhīn pradāsyantaṃ dānādhyakṣau nidhīśvaramghaṇṭānādaḥ pārśvamaulir ūcatur lobha mohitau
column2: As Kuvera was about to give the nine treasures, his two ministers, Ghaṇṭānāda and Pārśvamauli, who were bewildered with greed, spoke.

column1: dvāṭ ūcatuḥ eko 'yam brāhmaṇo lobhī nidhibhiḥ kim kariṣyatilakṣam divyam dehi cāsmai vṛttim rakṣa tathottarām
column2: The two ministers said: What will this greedy brāhmaṇa do with those great treasures? Give him a hundred thousand other things and keep the nine great treasures for yourself.

column1: śrī nārada uvāca paruṣam tad vacaḥ śrutvā durvāsāḥ krodha vigrahaḥ bhrū bhaìga kuṭilī bhūte rakta netre cakāra ha
column2: Śrī Nārada said: When he heard these harsh words Durvāsa' became filled with anger. His eyes were red and his eyebrows knitted with anger.

column1: sthalīva sarva brahmāṇòaṃ cacāla nimiṣa dvayampraṇatam dhanadam vīkṣya tābhyām śāpam dadau muniḥ
column2: For the time of two eyeblinks the entire universe shook. Seeing Kuvera humbly bowing down before him, Durvāsa' Muni proceeded to curse the two ministers.

column1: śrī munir uvāca ghaṇṭānāda mahā duṣṭa pāpa buddhe 'ti lubdhakagrāhavat tvam dhana grāhī grāho bhava mahā khala
column2: Śrī Durvāsa' said: Sinful, wicked, greedy Ghaṇṭānāda, you clutch at wealth as crocodile would clutch. I curse you: Become a crocodile!

column2: Śrī Rukmiṇī said: O Rādhā, O daughter of King Vṛṣabhānu, You are fortunate. Kṛṣṇa is conquered by Your love. He is under Your control. The three worlds glorify Kṛṣṇa, but Kṛṣṇa glorifies You.

column2: Śrī Nārada said: When they heard Śrī Rādhā's words, the queens repeated to Her what Lord Kṛṣṇa had told them. Hearing that, Noble hearted Rādha' became pleased and said, So be it.

column2: The karatālas, flute, and mṛaìgas joined with the sweet voices of the girls and the tinkling sounds of their belts and anklets, to create a tumultuous sound.

Lord Balarāma divided the gifts among the girls, giving some to each gopī. Then He dressed in one of the blue garments and decorated Himself with a necklace of gold and nine kinds of jewels. Then He enjoyed with the gopīs as the king of elephants enjoys with its many wives.

column1: itthaṃ kauravendra yādavendrasya rāmataḥ sarvā vāsantikīr niśā vyatītā babhūvuḥ . bhagavato balabhadrasya hastināpuram iva vīryaṃ sūcayatīva hy adyāpi ca kṛṣṭa vartmanā yamunā vahati. imaṃ rāmasya rāsa kathāṃ yaḥ śṛṇoti śrāvayati ca sa sarva pāpa paṭalaṃ chittvā tasya parasparam ānanda padaṃ pratiyāti. kiṃ bhūyaḥ śrotum icchasi.
column2: O king of the Kauravas, in this way Lord Balarāma, the king of the Yādavas, spent that springtime night with the gopīs. Even today the Yamuna' flows in many divided streams at that place, a testimony to the great strength, equal to that of a host of elephants, of Lord Balarāma, the Supreme Personality of Godhead. A person who hears or recounts these pastimes of Lord Balarāma destroys the entirety of a great host of sins and attains transcendental bliss. What more do you wish to hear?

column2: Duryodhana said: O master, you know everything. Please kindly repeat to me what Garga Muni spoke to the gopīs to tell them of the five part worship of Lord Balarāma.

column2: Śrī Prāòvipāka Muni said: O king of the Kauravas, one day Garga Muni left Mount Garga and went to Vraja to bathe in the Yamunā. In a certain forest grove by the Yamunā's shore, where gentle breezes moved the graceful trees, flowering vines, and new sprouts, and where the bees were maddened by the sweet scent of the flowers, some gopīs bowed down before Garga Muni, who was rapt in meditation on Lord Kṛṣṇa and Lord Balarāma. Remembering their previous birth as snake princesses, the gopīs asked him what kind of devotional service they should perform to attain the company of Lord Balarāma. Seeing their great devotion, Garga Muni gave these gopīs the paddhati, paṭala, stotra, kavaca, and sahasra nāma of Lord Balarāma. What more do you wish to hear? You may ask.

column1: niṣkāraṇaḥ paṭhed yas tu prīty arthaṃ revatī pateḥ nāmnāṃ sahasraṃ rājendra sa jīvan mukta ucyate
column2: O great king, one who without any personal motive, only to please Lord Balarāma, recites these thousand names, is said to be liberated in this life.

column1: sadā vaset tasya gṛhe balabhadro 'cyutāgrajaḥ mahā patāky api janaḥ paṭhen nāma sahasrakam
column2: Lord Balarāma, the elder brother of Lord Kṛṣṇa, eternally resides in the home of even a great sinner who recites these thousand names.

column1: chittvā meru samaṃ pāpaṃ bhuktvā sarva sukhaṃ tṭ ihaparāt paraṃ mahā rāja golokaṃ dhāma yāti hi
column2: O great king, that person destroys a host of sins equal to Mount Meru. He enjoys great happiness, and then He goes to the realm of Goloka, which is above the highest place in the spiritual world.

column1: śrī nārada uvāca iti śrutvacyutāgrajasya baladevasya pañcāìgam dhṛtimān dhārtarāṣṭraḥ saparyayā sahitayā parayā bhaktyā prāòvipākam pūjayām āsa tam anujñāpyāśiṣam dattvā prāòvipāko munīndro gajāhvayāt svāśramam jagāma.
column2: Śrī Nārada said: After hearing these five procedures for worshiping Lord Balarāma, the saintly son of Dhṛtarāṣṭtra worshiped Prāòvipka Muni with great devotion. After giving his blessings, Prāòvipka, the king of sages, left Hastināpura and returned to his own āśrama.

column1: bhagavato 'nantasya balabhadrasya para brahmaṇaḥ kathām yaḥ śṛṇute śrāvayate tayānanda mayo bhavati.
column2: One who hears or repeats these descriptions of limitless Lord Balarāma. the Supreme Personality of Godhead, becomes filled with bliss.

column1: idaṃ mayā te kathitaṃ nṛpendra sarvārthadaṃ śrī balabhadra khaṇòamśṛṇoti yo dhāma hareḥ sa yāti viśokam ānandam akhaṇòa rūpam
column2: O great king, thus I have recited for you the Balarāma khaṇòa, which fulfills all desires. Anyone who hears it goes to Lord Kṛṣṇa transcendental abode, which is eternal, full of bliss, and free of any suffering.
